data.text:
If you’re planning to travel to Singapore, you’ll likely use the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) system to get around. One station that you’ll want to check out is the Promenade MRT Station. Located in the Downtown Core, this underground station connects the Circle Line (CCL) and the Downtown Line (DTL), making it a convenient hub for transportation.

At Promenade MRT Station, you’ll find a range of amenities, including shops and dining options. The station is also located near several key attractions, such as Suntec City and the Marina Promenade. In addition, the station features unique art and architecture, adding to the overall experience of your visit.

Key Takeaways

Promenade MRT Station is a convenient transportation hub connecting the Circle Line and Downtown Line in Singapore’s Downtown Core.

The station offers a range of amenities, including shops and dining options, and is located near several key attractions.

Promenade MRT Station features unique art and architecture, adding to the overall experience of your visit.

Overview of Promenade MRT Station

If you’re in Singapore, you’ll want to know about the Promenade MRT Station. This underground station is located in the Downtown Core and serves as an interchange station for both the Circle Line and Downtown Line.

Location and Accessibility

The Promenade MRT Station is located underneath Temasek Avenue, adjacent to Millenia Tower. This makes it easily accessible to several key attractions and locations such as Suntec City and the Marina Promenade. The station is also located near Nicoll Highway, making it easy to get to other parts of Singapore.

Station Layout

The Promenade MRT Station is a modern and well-designed station. It has a total of seven floors, with the deepest platform being Basement 7. The station was opened on April 17, 2010, and has since become an important hub for commuters in Singapore.

Facilities and Services

The Promenade MRT Station has a range of facilities and services that make it a convenient place to travel from. The station has a number of ticketing machines, so you don’t have to worry about queuing up to purchase a ticket. There are also plenty of shops and restaurants located within the station, making it easy to grab a quick bite to eat before or after your journey.

In addition to these facilities, the Promenade MRT Station also has a number of services that make it a convenient and safe place to travel from. For example, there are plenty of security cameras located throughout the station, ensuring that you feel safe and secure at all times.

Overall, the Promenade MRT Station is an important part of Singapore’s MRT network. Whether you’re commuting to work or exploring the city, this station is a great place to start your journey.

Transport Connections

If you’re planning to travel to or from Promenade MRT Station in Singapore, you’ll be glad to know that there are several transport options available to you. Here are some of the most popular ones:

Bus Services

Promenade MRT Station is served by several bus services that stop at the nearby Marina Centre Terminal. From there, you can catch buses to various parts of Singapore, including the Central Business District, Orchard Road, and more. Some of the bus services that stop at Marina Centre Terminal include:

Bus 36: Goes to Changi Airport

Bus 56: Goes to Marina Bay Sands

Bus 97: Goes to Jurong East Interchange

Taxi Stands and Drop-Off Points

If you prefer to take a taxi to or from Promenade MRT Station, there are several taxi stands and drop-off points located nearby. The most convenient one is located at Exit B of the station, which is just a short walk away from the taxi stand.

Alternatively, you can also use the Marina Centre Taxi Stand, which is located just outside the Marina Centre Terminal. This taxi stand is usually less crowded than the one at Promenade MRT Station, so you may be able to get a taxi faster.

Overall, Promenade MRT Station is well-connected to the rest of Singapore, thanks to its convenient location and the various transport options available. Whether you’re traveling by bus or taxi, you’ll be able to reach your destination quickly and easily.

Nearby Attractions

If you find yourself near the Promenade MRT Station in Singapore, there are plenty of exciting attractions to explore. Whether you’re in the mood for shopping, entertainment, culture, or recreation, you’ll find something to suit your interests.

Shopping and Entertainment

If you’re a shopaholic, you’ll love the nearby Suntec City and Millenia Walk shopping malls. Both offer a wide range of shopping options, from high-end designer brands to affordable local boutiques. In addition to shopping, Suntec City also has a cinema, a bowling alley, and a variety of restaurants and cafes.

For entertainment, head over to the Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay. This iconic performing arts center hosts a variety of shows, from theater productions to music concerts. The Esplanade also has several bars and restaurants, making it a great spot for a night out.

Cultural and Recreational

If you’re interested in Singapore’s culture and history, check out the nearby National Stadium and The Float at Marina Bay. The National Stadium is the centerpiece of the Singapore Sports Hub and hosts a variety of sporting events and concerts. The Float at Marina Bay is a floating platform that hosts events such as the National Day Parade and the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

For a bird’s eye view of Singapore, head over to the Singapore Flyer. This giant observation wheel offers stunning views of the city skyline and the surrounding areas. If you’re feeling adventurous, you can also take a ride on the zipline at the nearby Mega Adventure Park.

Finally, for a more relaxed experience, take a stroll along the Marina Bay waterfront promenade. This scenic walkway offers beautiful views of the bay and the city skyline. As you walk, you’ll pass by landmarks such as the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotel and the towering Centennial Tower.

No matter what your interests are, the Promenade MRT Station area has something for everyone.

Transfers and Interchanges

As an interchange station, Promenade MRT Station offers convenient transfers between the Circle Line (CCL) and the Downtown Line (DTL). This makes it an important transportation hub for commuters traveling to and from various parts of Singapore.

Interchange Station Dynamics

Located in the Downtown Core, Promenade MRT Station serves as an important link between regular Circle Line train services to Dhoby Ghaut and Circle Line Extension train services to Harbourfront via Bayfront. With its strategic location, it also connects to other major MRT stations such as Bugis, City Hall, and Raffles Place.

Cross-Platform Interchange Benefits

One of the benefits of Promenade MRT Station is its cross-platform interchange feature. This means that passengers do not have to change platforms to transfer between the CCL and DTL. Instead, they can simply alight from one train and board the other on the same platform. This saves time and ensures a smooth transition between lines.

Moreover, the station is designed with clear signage and directions to help commuters navigate their way around. There are also staff members available to assist passengers with any queries or concerns they may have.

In conclusion, Promenade MRT Station offers a seamless and efficient transfer experience for commuters traveling to and from various parts of Singapore. Its strategic location and cross-platform interchange feature make it an important transportation hub for both locals and tourists alike.

Art and Architecture

If you’re an art lover, you’ll appreciate the unique blend of art and architecture at Promenade MRT Station Singapore. The station is home to several artworks that are part of the Art in Transit program, which is Singapore’s largest public art showcase.

Art in Transit Program

The Art in Transit program provides a platform for local artists to create original artworks for MRT stations, celebrating Singapore’s local history and community. At Promenade MRT Station, you’ll find several artworks that showcase the city’s vibrant art scene.

One of the most notable artworks at the station is “Earthcake” by Ana Prvacki. This stunning artwork incorporates kueh-inspired patterns and is located at the station’s Promenade Exit. Another notable artwork is “The Helix” by Phunk Studios. This artwork is located at the station’s Millenia Walk Exit and features a colorful spiral design that represents the DNA helix.

Station Design and Features

Aside from the artworks, Promenade MRT Station also boasts an impressive station design and features. The station is an underground Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) interchange station on the Downtown (DTL) and Circle (CCL) lines in Downtown Core, Singapore. Located underneath Temasek Avenue and adjacent to Millenia Tower, the station serves several key attractions and locations such as Suntec City and the Marina Promenade.

The station’s design features a modern and sleek look, with a predominantly white color scheme. The station is also designed with accessibility in mind, with features such as barrier-free access and tactile guidance systems for the visually impaired.

Overall, Promenade MRT Station Singapore is a must-visit for art and architecture enthusiasts. With its unique blend of art and design, it’s a true gem in Singapore’s public transportation system.

Safety and Security

When traveling on public transport, safety and security are always a top priority. At Promenade MRT Station in Singapore, you can rest assured that measures have been put in place to ensure your safety and security.

Emergency Protocols

In the event of an emergency, Promenade MRT Station has emergency protocols in place to ensure your safety. The station is equipped with fire alarms, fire extinguishers, emergency lighting, and emergency exits. The station also has an intercom system that allows you to communicate with station staff in case of an emergency.

If you notice any suspicious behavior or unattended bags, please report it to the station staff immediately. They will be able to take the necessary measures to ensure everyone’s safety.

Station Surveillance

Promenade MRT Station is equipped with a state-of-the-art surveillance system to ensure the safety and security of all passengers. The Land Transport Authority has installed CCTV cameras throughout the station to monitor passenger activity and detect any suspicious behavior.

The surveillance system is monitored by station staff and the police, who are stationed at the station to ensure your safety. The system allows them to respond quickly to any emergency situations.

In conclusion, Promenade MRT Station takes your safety and security seriously. Emergency protocols and station surveillance are in place to ensure that you have a safe and comfortable journey.

Future Developments

Exciting developments are in store for Promenade MRT Station Singapore, with new projects set to enhance the station’s connectivity and accessibility. Here are some of the upcoming developments that will make Promenade MRT Station an even more convenient and attractive transport hub.

Circle Line Extension Plans

The Circle Line Extension (CLE) is a major project by the Land Transport Authority (LTA) that will extend the Circle Line from HarbourFront to Marina Bay. The extension will include three new stations, one of which will be located at Marina Promenade, just a short walk from Promenade MRT Station.

The CLE is expected to be completed by 2025, and will provide a direct connection from Promenade MRT Station to Marina Bay and HarbourFront. This will make it easier for you to travel to popular destinations such as Sentosa Island, VivoCity, and the Singapore Cruise Centre.

Upcoming Connectivity Projects

In addition to the CLE, there are several other connectivity projects in the works that will benefit Promenade MRT Station. For example, the upcoming North-South Corridor (NSC) will provide a direct link between Woodlands and the city centre, passing through the Marina Bay area.

The NSC will include dedicated bus lanes and cycling paths, making it easier for you to travel to and from Promenade MRT Station. This will also improve the station’s accessibility for residents living in the northern part of Singapore.

Another project that will benefit Promenade MRT Station is the upcoming Thomson-East Coast Line (TEL). The TEL will connect Woodlands in the north to Changi Airport in the east, passing through the Marina Bay area. The TEL will also provide a direct connection to the upcoming Terminal 5 at Changi Airport.

In conclusion, the future looks bright for Promenade MRT Station Singapore, with new connectivity projects and the Circle Line Extension set to enhance the station’s accessibility and convenience. Whether you are a resident or a visitor, you can look forward to an even more seamless and enjoyable travel experience in the years to come.

Frequently Asked Questions

How can I reach Suntec City from Promenade MRT?

Suntec City is conveniently located near Promenade MRT Station. In fact, you can reach Suntec City by taking Exit C from the station. Once you exit the station, simply follow the signs to Suntec City. The walk from the station to Suntec City takes approximately 5-7 minutes.

Where can I find a map of Promenade MRT exits?

You can find a map of Promenade MRT exits on the official website of SMRT. Alternatively, you can also find a map of the station exits on the Land Transport Guru website. Both maps provide a clear and detailed view of the station exits, making it easy for you to navigate your way around the station.

Which exit at Promenade MRT leads to Millenia Walk?

If you’re looking to visit Millenia Walk, you should take Exit B from Promenade MRT Station. Once you exit the station, simply follow the signs to Millenia Walk. The walk from the station to Millenia Walk takes approximately 3-5 minutes.

What’s the last train timing for the Downtown Line at Promenade MRT?

The last train timing for the Downtown Line at Promenade MRT varies depending on the day of the week. On weekdays, the last train towards Bukit Panjang departs at 11:49 PM, while the last train towards Expo departs at 11:38 PM. On weekends and public holidays, the last train towards Bukit Panjang departs at 11:49 PM, while the last train towards Expo departs at 11:38 PM.

How many exits does Promenade MRT Station have?

Promenade MRT Station has a total of 4 exits, namely Exit A, Exit B, Exit C, and Exit D. Each exit is strategically located to provide easy access to nearby attractions and landmarks.

Which exit should I take for the Pan Pacific hotel from Promenade MRT?

If you’re looking to visit the Pan Pacific hotel, you should take Exit D from Promenade MRT Station. Once you exit the station, simply follow the signs to the Pan Pacific hotel. The walk from the station to the hotel takes approximately 5-7 minutes.
